h1: Income Tax Penalties & Late Filing Rules in Bangladesh

sections.title: Filing Deadline
sections.intro: The standard income tax return filing deadline in Bangladesh is:
items: 30 November of each assessment year (subject to extension by NBR)
Employers and companies may have different deadlines — check NBR notices for updates
Extensions may be granted in specific circumstances, but are not guaranteed
sections.note: Mark your calendar — late filing triggers automatic penalties

sections.title: What Happens If You File Late?
sections.intro: Filing your income tax return after the deadline can result in:
items: Minimum fine of BDT 1,000 (even for nil returns)
Penalty of 10% of the last assessed tax (if applicable)
Additional daily penalty of BDT 50 per day of delay
Possible compliance restrictions — problems obtaining bank loans, property transfers, or trade license renewals
Negative impact on your tax compliance record with NBR

sections.title: Can You Avoid the Penalty?
items: File before receiving a notice from NBR — voluntary late filing may reduce penalties
Apply for a deadline extension before the due date (if applicable)
File a revised return if you've already submitted an incomplete or incorrect return
Engage a tax advisor to handle the regularization process on your behalf

items.text: TIN holders who haven't filed previously

faq.question: What is the minimum penalty for late tax filing in Bangladesh?
faq.answer: The minimum penalty is BDT 1,000, regardless of your income level. This applies even if you have a nil tax return.

faq.question: Can I file my return after the deadline?
faq.answer: Yes, you can still file a late return. However, you will be subject to penalties. Filing voluntarily before receiving an NBR notice may help reduce the penalty.

faq.question: Does late filing affect my ability to get bank loans?
faq.answer: Yes. Banks and financial institutions often require an up-to-date tax clearance certificate. Late filing or non-filing can create problems when applying for loans.

faq.question: Is there a daily penalty for late filing?
faq.answer: Yes. In addition to the minimum fine, a daily penalty of BDT 50 per day may apply from the day after the deadline until the return is filed.

faq.question: Can a tax consultant help reduce my penalty?
faq.answer: A qualified tax consultant can help regularize your filing, ensure accurate return preparation, and guide you through the penalty minimization process.
